title: Military Insubordinations
body: We only have knowledge of the following insubordinations that occurred on the island of Madeira: in July 1829, in the 13th infantry regiment, because an officer who was a stranger to the corporation was appointed as interim commander; on July 30, 1852, in the 6th hunters battalion, when Lieutenant Lapierre was killed; and on August 2, 1870, in the 5th hunters battalion, following a weapons inspection. Military Garrison and Lapierre.

Lapierre: Lieutenant killed during the military insubordination
